meanings.definition: To surpass in learning or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: She is outlearning her classmates in math.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys outlearning new facts about space.
meanings.sent3: The young student was outlearning the older ones, much to their surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for reading is outlearning any obstacle in her way.
meanings.sent5: The determined scientist was outlearning the limitations of current technology.

meanings.definition: The act of surpassing in learning or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: His outlearning of others in science is impressive.
meanings.sent2: The competition encourages healthy outlearning among students.
meanings.sent3: The outlearning of the young prodigy was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her outlearning of the subject was like a beacon of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The outlearning of the team led to great success in the competition.
